title: Gadha Krishna Leons
text:
About Me
I am a PhD Scholar in Hematologic Oncology at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi.
My work operates at the intersection of Cancer Genetics and Bioinformatics. I utilize high-throughput sequencing (RNA-Seq) and functional genomics to decipher the molecular landscape of B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (B-ALL). My goal is to identify novel predictive biomarkers and therapeutic targets for high-risk, relapsed leukemia subtypes.
I am currently seeking Postdoctoral opportunities to further explore cancer evolution using multi-omics approaches.



Interests
Cancer Genomics (B-ALL Subtyping) Transcriptomics (RNA-Seq Analysis) Precision Medicine Functional Genomics (CRISPR-Cas9)

title: Gadha Krishna Leons
text:
Research Focus
My research investigates the molecular landscape of B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (B-ALL). I specialize in identifying predictive biomarkers and novel fusions in BCR::ABL1-negative B-ALL to drive personalized medicine approaches.

title: Gadha Krishna Leons
text:
Current Work

Genomic Profiling: Investigating genetic subtypes and fusions in B-ALL using RNA-Seq and functional assays.
Drug Targets: Studying predictive and prognostic molecular aberrations to improve patient outcomes.
